First you need to start listening to the track
No update available. Check for updates again later!

Prima is an android music player that works with tracks, artists and albums on your device. It supports a lot of file formats: from .wav to mp3. Prima supports audio books. Also Prima has equalizer, audio trimmer, YouTube to MP3 converter and a lot of other cool features. Prima is fully customisable: you can choose language (20 languages), font (near 100) and themes. You are also able to set your own background image. You can find everything in settings.

Prior to Android 10, Prima can easily change the metadata of tracks. In Android 10, the application will request modification permission for each file that you want to change. Since Android 11, changing the metadata of tracks has become a big problem, due to the fact that in Android 10 they switched to a different type of storage. However, it is possible to change the track parameters in my application, but these changes will only work in my application, because I do not change the metadata itself, but simply replace the data when it is loaded.

For full functionality, Prima requests the necessary permissions. First of all, it asks about reading files on your device. Well, it is obvious - app works with music on your device. The second one is about phone state. It needs to run background service, so you can start listening to the music, switch on another app, but music will continue playing. Also service uses headset buttons and their callbacks. The third one is about audio recording. Prima itself does not record anything - it is used to show beautiful audio visualizer when you listening to the music and that is all. The last one is about reading contacts on your phone. It is used for audio trimmer to set a ringtone for a specific contact. Also, if you are an Android 11+ user and you use full version (only for Android 11+), app will request permission about reading and changing all files in external storage. Don’t worry, you are safe :} It is needed to generate new music files (for example in audio trimmer, or from YouTube

Custom playlists are playlists created by user. They are fully modifiable: you can change their title, image, add some tracks or even remove them. You can not have two or more playlists with the same title - the new one will not be created.

I have translated Prima only into the most used languages. If your language is not among them, you should not be sad - you can write to me (the developer) about it and I will definitely add your language if I will find a translator. However, I can not promise that the translation will be correct, even today translators make mistakes. Unfortunately, I am not a guru of foreign languages and I speak only English and Russian, so there may be translation inaccuracies in the application. If you find an error, let me know about it.

To put it simply, the equalizer is a tool that allows you to adjust the sound. In my equalizer, you can modify the frequencies, bass, reverb, pitch and speed. (You cannot change pitch and speed in Android 6 and 10. Android 6 doesn\'t support them and Android 10 can\'t have more than one audio effect at the same time) You can enable it when you started listening for the first time during the session. This is due to the fact that the equalizer needs to know which audio session to change. Also in the settings you can select the item about starting with an equalizer. After you have started listening to a track for the first time, you can turn it on and off at any time. For phones, the equalizer is not supported in a horizontal position due to the fact that it is quite problematic to place it conveniently and its use becomes very difficult on narrow phones. This rule does not apply to tablets and other android devices with large screens. The equalizer is located at the bottom of the playing panel. It has a double pyramid icon.

Audio trimmer is a tool to trim music files. It also supports playback of content you want to cut. First you need to set a start and end border. You can do this in two ways: enter the time manually or by dragging the boundaries along the waveform. To save cut content you should click on save menu. You will see a dialog about saving format. If you choose a ringtone format, you can also set your cut music to a specific contact. If you choose other variants, file will be saved in chosen format. For example, if you choose alarm, you will see your cut track in alarm’s tracks. It takes some time to finish shortening a track (usually a few seconds, but it depends on the length of the track), so be patient :)

MP3 converter is a tool that helps you to convert audio from some site (like YouTube, Facebook and so on) to MP3 format. It supports a lot of sites (full list of them: https://ytdl-org.github.io/youtube-dl/supportedsites.html). It’s quit simple to use - just follow the instructions. Installation of track requires some time, so be patient :}
10. How to contact with the developer?
You can contact me via Github, VKontakte or via email. To do this, go to “About App” and select the appropriate communication method for you.
9. Are there any ads in the app?

No, there are no ads in the app. I did not set out to earn money from my users, so you will not find any advertising content in my application. For the fact that you use my application, I do not receive a single cent to my account, so I will be very happy if you rate my application on the play market or github. Thank you for being here :}
Not supported on your device. I am really sorry :(

This feature requires internet connection. To use it, you need to login in Music API site and print your API key in dialog. You need to do it only once and after that you can use it as long as you wish. I am sorry, but I can not afford premium services with unlimited web calls :(
It seems that your API key is wrong. Try to change it.

Due to the fact that Google\‘s storage policy has changed, Android 11+ requires permission to read and change files in the storage. This permission is only needed to create new music files, and in the case of changes to the metadata of tracks it changes the music files\’ data. Don’t worry, the application does not perform any malicious manipulations with your data. You are safe :}
Something went wrong. Check your internet connection and try again
All information is taken from the Genius website: https://genius.com
What kind of game is this?
"Guess the Melody" is a game in which the knowledge of the songs in your playlists is tested. You need to guess the song by choosing one of four options

First you need to select a playlist. You can select all the tracks that are in the external storage, albums (by track metadata) and playlists created by you. You can also create your own temporary playlist for the game. Then you need to specify the maximum number of songs that will be in the game. If you specify more songs than in the playlist, you will have to guess all the songs from this playlist.

After selecting a playlist, the game starts. The track is played from an arbitrary location. You can listen to the track as much as you need. The essence of the game is to choose the name of the song (with the author). If you do not guess, the correct answer is highlighted for you. At the end of the game, the result and the list of the wrong songs are displayed.
Are you sure you want to exit?
Track number must be bigger than 0
Playback time must be bigger than 0
The playlist must contain at least 4 tracks
Sleep time must be bigger than 0
